{"step_by_step_thinking": "Odontoblasts are the cells responsible for the formation of dentin in the tooth. They originate from the dental papilla of the tooth germ. The dental papilla is composed of undifferentiated mesenchymal cells, which are capable of differentiating into a variety of cell types, including odontoblasts. Histocytes, macrophages, and lymphocytes are all types of immune cells and are not involved in tooth development.", "answer_choice": "A. Undifferentiated mesenchymal cells"}
